pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: pisatapangan to a minanam, micomoday to ko singsi i laloma’ no pitilidan, “katomireng, mita’ong” sa ko kakeridan.
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”
我今天七點到學校。: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: sata’angay sa ko ngiha niyam a pasowal to “nga’ay ho singsi.”
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: to pinanaman i, pasifana’en no singsi kami to sa’osi no ’Amis.
In class, the teacher taught us the ’Amis language of numbers.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: todongan niyam ko pisa’osi no singsi, radiwan niyam ko sa’osi.
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: adihay to ko kafana’an no mako to sowal no ’Amis.
I have learned many ’Amis languages.
我今天七點到學校。: 我學會好多族語。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: mitilid kako to romi’ami’ad, minanam kako to sowal no ’Amis to romi’ami’ad, papitengilen ako ci ina to sowal ako.
I go to school every day, I learn the ’Amis language every day, and I want to tell my mother.
我今天七點到學校。: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: ci Kacaw ko ngangan no mako.
My name is kacaw.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的名字是kacaw。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: ci Asing ko ngangan no wama ako.
My dad’s name is Asing.
我今天七點到學校。: 我爸爸的名字是Asing。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: ci Panay ko ngangan no wina ako.
My mother’s name is Panay.
我今天七點到學校。: 我媽媽的名字是Panay。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: mo^tepay to ko mihecaan no mako anini.
I am 10 years old.
我今天七點到學校。: 我今年10歲。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: cecayay ko kaka ako, ci Kulas ko ngangan ningra, cecayay to ko safaw ko mihecaan ningra.
I have a brother, his name is kulas, he is 11 years old.
我今天七點到學校。: 我有一個哥哥，他叫kulas，他今年11歲。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: malacecayay ko pitilidan niyam a mitilid.

我今天七點到學校。: 我們在同一間學校讀書。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: maolah kako aci kaka a romadiw.
Both my brother and I like to sing.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: maolah kako a midangoy, paaliwacan i, malahakelong ko paro no loma’ niyam a midangoy.

我今天七點到學校。: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: maolah kako a misawidang to fa^lohay a widang, manga’ay kami a malacafay romadiw ato midangoy.
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: o wawa no ’Amis kako.

我今天七點到學校。: 我是阿美族的小孩。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: i Posongay ko loma’ niyam.
Our family lives in Posongay.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: lalima ko paro no loma’ niyam.
There are five people in our family.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們家共有五個人。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: tatolo kami a malakaka.

我今天七點到學校。: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: malacafay kako to wama, wina, kaka to fa’inayan ato kaka to fafahiyan a ma’orip.

我今天七點到學校。: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: akawangay ko wama ako, o malatayxinay ko wama ako.

我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: mangiliway ko wina ako, o malaisingay ko wina ako.
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: sano’Amisan no wama kami a caciyaw i loma’.
My father speaks the ’Amis language with us at home.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: pa’aliwacan to kaciherangan i, minokay kami a talaniyaro’.

我今天七點到學校。: 我們暑假都會回部落。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: malacafay kako to kaka to fa’inayan fafahiyan a mitakora’.
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: maolah kako to paro no loma’ niyam.
I like our family very much.
我今天七點到學校。: 我很喜歡我們家的人。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: masadakay kako aci ina a misalama anini.

我今天七點到學校。: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: sa langdaw sa ko kakarayan to romo’ad, cowa kafa^det cowa kasi^naw, saemelay ko falifali.

我今天七點到學校。: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: i rengorengosan kami a komaen to ^pang, mapaedil no cidal ko tatirengan, tada dihekoay.

我今天七點到學校。: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: herek no lahok, masakahengangay to ko kakarayan.

我今天七點到學校。: 下午，天空變紅了。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: licay han ako ci ina, mana kahengang ko kakarayan.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: sowal sa ci ina, wa aira ko faliyos a tayni alatek.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: awaay ko to’em/kadit i kakarayan, masadakay to ko fo’is.

我今天七點到學校。: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: wa maminokay to kami.
We were going home too.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們也要回家了。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: i fatad no pinokayan a lalan, ira ko pinanay no faloco’ ako to fo’is.
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,
我今天七點到學校。: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: nanay aka ho katayni koni a faliyos, sakasadakan nanay ho kako a misalama.
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.
我今天七點到學校。: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: i tatihiay no loma’ ako ko pitilidan, saka rakat sanay kako a talapitilidan, rakat sanay kako a minokay to romi’ami’ad.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: cowa katata’ang ko pitilidan niyam, cowa ka’aloman ko mitiliday, sahto o kananaman to.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: cowa kata’angay ko pitilidan niyam, cowa ka’aloman ko mitiliday, sahto o kananaman to.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: mapolong ko kaemangay a masa’opo i kasa’opoan a malacecay ko pisalama kalalicay.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: mikihatiyaay ko singsi i tamiyanan a misalama, o ta’angyay to a laloma’an ko pitilidan.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: miasikay to kami to romi’ami’ad, songila’en ita a miasik ko pitilidan.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: misifin ko roma to sasingaran, miasik ko roma to paenan.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: mafana’ aca kami a miasik to tadimocomocok no pitilidan, mala’esal kita to tatayalen nga’ , makapah ko pitilidan to romi’ami’ad.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: halafinay to a ca kasaso’araw kami, ma’ilolay to kako i cingranan.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: paka’araw ci akong i takowanan, tangsol sa a pakaen i takowanan to kacawas, pananom to uciya i takowanan.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: ko^sanay ko nipalomaan ni akong a kacawasay, so^lin tada nga’ayay to a kaenen.

我今天七點到學校。: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: maolahay kako to uciya ni akong, nga’ayay to a nanomen.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: kalahokan to i, malacafay kako aci mamoan a misakalahok.

Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: maherek a malahok i, tayraay kami i padatengan a midateng.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: micomod to kami i pinanowangan, sowal sa ko singsi, “o ’aya’ayaman ko i ka’ayaway, o ’oner’oneran ko kaikoray, pakoniyaniyah sa kita a mi’araw.”

我今天七點到學校。: so you can visit them yourself.""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34093/5: 進入動物園後，老師說:「前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。」

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: ma’araw ako ko adihayay a ’ayam misaefeefer cangra i kilakilangan, ma’araw ho ako ko ekong a mafoti’ i dihif.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: ira aca ko eco, efa ato lokdaw i pinanowangan, sahto sa o cowa ho ka’araw ako i ’ayaw ho, salipahak sa kako a paka’araw anini.

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: adihayay ko nisasingan ako to hasapanengneng ci mamaan ci inaan.

我今天七點到學校。: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: saka, anini a mihecaan to pipa’aliwacan to kaciherangan, minokay kako ato kaka ako a tayra i niyaro’ a milicay to malitengay/mato’asay to sakafana’aw to serangawan no niyah a finacadan.
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.
我今天七點到學校。: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: faloay to a polo’ ko mihecaan nora mato’asay, nengneng han hato kaemangay ho.
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.
我今天七點到學校。: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: o manan manan a sowalan ko kafana’an iso a somowal han ako a milicay cingra, tanestesay ko sowal ningra tono ’Amis, mafana’ aca a somowal tono Piyoma, payrang ato no Dipong.
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in ’Amis, as well as Pinuyumayan, Hokkien and Japanese.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他會哪些語言，他的阿美語說得很流利，也會說卑南語、閩南語和日本話。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: licay han ako cingra a mafana’ kako, yo kaemang ho cingra i, minanamay to to sowal no Dipong, o Piyoma ko fafahi ningra, alomanay aca ko kananaman ningra a Payrang i katayalan saka, adihay ko kafana’an ningra a sowal.
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Pinuyumayan, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是卑南族人，而他工作上認識許多閩南人，所以他會說這麼多語言。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: itini to kalalicay niyam, adihay ko makitohay no mato’asay to pakiniay to fenek no mi’adopay.
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: talacowa cowa katadafana’ kami a mitengil nika, tanotingwaan no niyam a misasing nga’, nga’ay ko pisaliyaliyaw no niyam a mitengil.
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.
我今天七點到學校。: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: cowa kafana’ kako to serangawan no niyah i kakaemangan ho, pakini to no niyah o Yencumin a tireng i, mangodoay to ko harateng.
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.
我今天七點到學校。: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: ikor to haw i, mafana’ to kako to tireng no niyah o ’Amis, o tadamaanay o micidekay, o kalita’angan to konini!
The more I know, the more I feel that being a ’Amis is unique and something to be proud of.
我今天七點到學校。: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為阿美族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: wa minokay to ko safa to fa’inayan anini to kakeremam.
My younger brother is going home this evening.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: tayra kako aci mamo i cifa a mi’aca to koko’, misaday to ’aredetay a sakalafi to hano safa.
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: mata’elif niyam ko paliwalay to dateng, adihay ko ko^ngelay a dateng to papaliwalen no paliwalay.
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: o incay, korto ato ningcing ko mi’acaan niyam.
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: sowal sa koya tatihiay a tawki toya paliwalay to losay, “ko^sanay ko talacay ato lopas no mako, ’acaen ko pinapina makena!”
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”
我今天七點到學校。: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: ’acaan to niyam ko talacay ato lopas.
We bought pineapples and peaches.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: mata’elif niyam ko paliwalay to titi, sowal sa koya tawki, “o manan ko ’a’acaen no miso? ta’angayay maso^so aca koni a koko’ anini, tolo a so’ot ko ’aca no cecay.”
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: ’atekakan nanay ci mamo, manga’ay a saka’emeden to mamang han nira koya tawki a milicay.
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: nikawrira, ka’emeday to, caay to kanga’ay a lowanen sa ko sowal noya tawki.
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.
我今天七點到學校。: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: pasowal sa koya tatihiay a tawki, “katayni a mi’aca to foting ako, ta’angayay ka’emeday aca ko foting ako.”
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.
我今天七點到學校。: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: ikor to i, ma’aca to niyam ko koko’ ato foting, minokay a tahaloma’ i, tangsol sa a mitangtang to cecay a ’eto a kakaenen.
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.
我今天七點到學校。: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: halafinay to ko pitatala, to’eman sa to ko romi’ad.
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.
我今天七點到學校。: 等了好久，天已經黑了。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: sa to’eman sa to ko romi’ad to pitatalaan.
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.
我今天七點到學校。: 等了好久，天已經黑了。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: patingwa ko safa a pasowal, safana’sa a awa ko ’aliwac no sofitay sa, roma sa to a lipay to pa’aliwacan nga’ manga’ay a minokay saan.
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.
我今天七點到學校。: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: pasowal sa ci mamo, “adihayay to ko mitangtangan, tahidangen to ko ’alomanay a mitahka.”
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: matahidang to niyam ko salawinawina ato widawidang a malacecay a mitahka tona kadofahay a sakalafi.
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: iraay ko cecay a kapot ako ci Kacaw halitawalay cingra a mihawikid to kalimaamaan.
I have a classmate named Kacaw, he often forgets to bring things.
我今天七點到學校。: 我有一個同學叫Kacaw，他常常忘記帶東西。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: to pinanaman i, micaliw cingra to impic, sararop anca o tilid no kapot.
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: kinacecay, kinatosa, kinatolo pacaliwan to no ’alomanay cingra to kalimaamaan.
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.
我今天七點到學校。: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: nikawrira iraay koya tati’ihay a pinangan ningra, mafana’ay a micaliw, mafokilay a patikol.
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.
我今天七點到學校。: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: saikor to i, cowa to kakahi a pacaliw ko ’alomanay i cingranan.
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.
我今天七點到學校。: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: yo cecay a romi’ad, mapolong kami a malacafay a misalama.
One day, we all went on an outing together.
我今天七點到學校。: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: i fatad no lalan, ka’enihay ci Kacaw, nikawrira matawal ningra ko sa’ilos.
On the way, Kacaw wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.
我今天七點到學校。: 路途中，Kacaw想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: micaliw cingra to sa’ilos i kapokapotan, cowa kapihawikid kako han no ’alomanay cingra a pasowal.
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.
我今天七點到學校。: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: tangic sato ci Kacaw to caroh ningra. keter sa a somowal, “mana cowa kakahi kamo a pacaliw i takowanan to sa’ilos!”
Kacaw burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!
我今天七點到學校。: Kacaw急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: pakafana’ han no kapot cingra, cowa kapihawikid kiso to no miso, ya mipacaliwan i tisowanan a dafong i, cowa ho kapatikolen iso.
The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!
我今天七點到學校。: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: to roma sa to a romi’ad a mitilid, pacerem ci Kacaw a talapitilidan, ya micalwan ho ni Kacaw a dafong i, patikolen to ningra ko kapot.
The next day at school, Kacaw arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.
我今天七點到學校。: 隔天上學，Kacaw很早就到學校了，Kacaw把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: ta’ong han to ni Kacaw ko kapokapot a pasowal, ikor to haw i, mihawikid to cingra to no niyah to a dafong, miaray aca cingra to pipacaliw no kapot i cingraan i ’ayaw.
kacaw apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.
我今天七點到學校。: Kacaw向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: o mi’adopay a tamdaw ko wama ako.
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: yo kaemang ho kako, mihawikid ci ama aci faki to fonos ato kowang a malingad to dadaya.
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.
我今天七點到學校。: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: kanikaran to i, mapanokay to nangra ko tama’ a minokay.
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: to roma i, o fafoy anca o lawal, latekay ira ko tolok.
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.
我今天七點到學校。: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: misilsil cangra to tama’ i ’adawang, palilamen nangra ko finawlan.
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: micaraan to ako ci ama, mi’ocil a malahakelong ci wamaan a mi’adop.
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.
我今天七點到學校。: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: ta’angay to kiso nga’ keriden ako kiso sa ci ama i takowanan.
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: to sakanga’ayaw no mako a mitoor to mato’asay a mi’adop, milisiw kako a misanga’ to talakal , so’elin narikay a citama’ to ’a’adopen ko talakal no mako.
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practice making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: paka’araw ci ama, sowal sa i takowanan, cowa kaeca o mamalasaidahiay a mi’adopay a tamdaw kiso sa.
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: mato’as to kako, koyoden to ako ko focol ato pana’ a mihakelong ci amaan a mi’adop.
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: ano patatikol to i niyaro’ i, wapalilamen ko finawlan to tama’ no pi’adop ako.
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: sowal sa ci ama, “kansiyaen ita ko palemed no to’as, adihay ko kinaira ita a mi’adop.”
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Maapac kako to dafak a talapitilidan.
I was late for school this morning.
我今天七點到學校。: 我早上上學遲到了。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Matawal ako mihawikid to, kafang a talapitilidan.
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
我今天七點到學校。: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Awaawaay ko mihawikidan ako.
I didn't bring anything with me.
我今天七點到學校。: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Misatapang to a minanam, malacafay a minengneng to codad kako ato kapot ako.
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Misatapang to a miseking, pacaliw ko kapot to impic ato sararop i takowanan.
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.
我今天七點到學校。: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Sowal sa ko singsi i takowanan “karatar to a lomowad, aka to kaapac!”
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""
我今天七點到學校。: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Sanga’ayay a widang ako ci Kacaw, o wawa no Pangcah cingra.
My good friend’s name is Kacaw, and he is also an Amis child.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的好朋友叫Kacaw，他也是阿美族的小孩。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Malacafay kami a mitilid i Tafalong a niyaro’.
We study together in the Tafalong tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們一起在太巴塱部落讀書。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Pararid kami a malacecay mitengil to ko pikimad no mato’asay, tadamafana’ to kami a caciyaw to sowal no Pangcah.
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Amis proficiently.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說阿美語。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Takaraw a masoeso kako, poener a makoli ci Kacaw.
I am tall and overweight, while Kacaw is short and thin.
我今天七點到學校。: 我很高也很胖，Kacaw很矮也很瘦。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Tada tariktikay ci Kacaw, maolah kami cingraan a mapolong.
Kacaw is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.
我今天七點到學校。: Kacaw很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: O piongtokay no pitilidan a romi’ad anini, adihay ko lalifeten no pitilidan.
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Ira ko masasolotay, micokaray to mali, comikayay, masakeroay ato mipana’ay.
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
我今天七點到學校。: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: O comikayay ko milifetan ako.
I participated in the running competition.
我今天七點到學校。: 我比賽跑步。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Yo comikayay ho kako i, matolo’ay, mare:mesay ko tosor ako.
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.
我今天七點到學校。: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Na lomowad kako, lingatoen ako comikay a tala’ayaw.
But I stood up and continued running forward.
我今天七點到學校。: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Tahira to kako i pasetokan malipahak ko polong a maemin.
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.
我今天七點到學校。: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Talacowa awa maala ko sakacecay, nikaorira mahemekay to kako, hawhani malaheci to ako ko pilalifetan.
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.
我今天七點到學校。: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Talamiliso’ ci fakian kako ato ci mama ako inacila.
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天我和我爸爸去拜訪叔叔。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Madoka’ ko wa’ay ni faki.
My uncle injured his foot.
我今天七點到學校。: 叔叔的腳受傷了。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Pasowal sa cingra i tamiyanan, ma’epong ko fadahong no loma’.
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.
我今天七點到學校。: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Misanga’ ho cingra to fadahong i, nani fadahong a matefad.
He fell off the roof while repairing it.
我今天七點到學校。: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂掉下來了。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Mihawikid ci mama to titi no kolong ato ’icep a pafeli ci fakian.
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Miholol kako ato ci faki i kafoti’an, adihay ko mipalada’an ningra a kimad.
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: I’ayaw no piliyas ako, malata’ang ci faki i takowanan, takaraw to a tanektek to saan.
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.
我今天七點到學校。: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Sowal han nako “maadah to ko wa’ay ni faki, liyaw han tayni misalama i loma’ niyam.”
I said, When your foot gets better
我今天七點到學校。: come to our house next time and visit us.""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34093/5: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Itini i tosa patek tosa polo’ ira ko tosa a mihecaan i, mikayki ko sifo to sakacipinang no tireng no Yin-cu-min a manga’ay micidek to ngangan no finacadan a kayki.
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.
我今天七點到學校。: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名會議。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Milicay kako to matenesay misi’ayaway to sifo a milongoc to sakacipinang no tireng “micidek to ngangan no finacadan” a kapah no niyaro’ ci Foting Mayaw.
I interviewed Foting Mayaw, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.
我今天七點到學校。: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年 Foting Mayaw。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Masasowal to kami a tayra i loma’ ningra malalicay cingraan toni a pa’aliwacan.
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Malalicay ho i, pasifana’en ningra kako to na icowaay ko lalengawan no ngangan ningra, pasifana’en ningra kako to paro no loma’ ningra, o niyaro’ ningra.
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，他也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Licay han ako cingraan ano pacici han a mifalic to ngangan, tati’ih ko katelangay a pasingsi hayda?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Sowal saan cingra i takowanan, nawhani o tilid no holam caay ka polita a pakafana’ to ngangan ningra, maceli’ ho no roma a tamdaw cingraan ci Fo先生 sanay, orasaka ira to ko adihayay a tatawaen masadak.
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Fu Xian Sheng
我今天七點到學校。: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34093/5: 他對我說，因為用中文字並不能準確的傳達他的名字，其他人還會叫他「福先生」，也因此鬧出不少笑話。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Sowal sa ci Foting Mayaw, “o tilid no sowal no Yin-cu-min a ngangan i, o tadaso’elinay a ngangan no mita. O ngangan no mako i, o citodongay to finacadan no mita, laloma’an no mita, pinangan no tireng no mita, nanay ira ko ’aloman a ’aloman ko finawlan manga’ay patatikol to ngangan no niyah.”
Foting Mayaw said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group
我今天七點到學校。: our family
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34093/5: our identity. I hope more fellow tribespeople can reclaim their own names.\""
column5: Foting Mayaw說：「原住民語書寫的名字，才是我們真正的名字。我的名字，代表了我們的族群、我們的家族、我們的身分，希望能有更多族人恢復自己的名字。」

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Mitoor kako ci amaan inacila tayra i icifa a pa’aca, adihay ko mihawikidan mipalomaan ni ama to dateng a tayra, ira ko misanga’an kaeso’ay a kakaenen no Pangcah a pafeli to ’alomanay.
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民(阿美族)美食給大家。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Maolah ko polong to pipa’acaan ni ama, ’aloman ko mi’acaay to damdam ato kakorot, ’aloman ko tayniay mitanam to mitangtangan ningra a kakaenen.
Everyone loved my grandmother's stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.
我今天七點到學校。: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Tadakaeso’ay ko mitangtangan ningra to lokot ato hakhak, ira ho ko mapacamolay to linnalo a kohaw no tefo’, masolot no sanek ko ’alomanay a lafang, misarayaray to polong a tayni i pipa’acaan niyam.
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.
我今天七點到學校。: 她煮的山蘇和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用醃肉煮的竹筍湯，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Mitangtang ho ci ama i, miholol kako to lafang i tatihi. ’ang’ang han ako i tatihi “o mipalomaan niyam ko dateng, awaay ko sapaiyo, kalamkamen a tayni mi’aca yo!”
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, The vegetables are self-grown
我今天七點到學校。: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34093/5: 奶奶煮東西的時候，我在旁邊招攬客人。我在一旁大喊著：「蔬菜都是自己種的，沒有灑農藥，趕快來買喔!」

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Harakat a maemin mapa’aca ko papa’acaen niyam, sowal sa ci ama “nanay saheto kiso iraay ho ko pipadang.”
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, It's all thanks to your help.""
我今天七點到學校。: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Oni a demak i, mafana’ to kako to nai pinalengaw no Yin-cu-min ato kakaenen a fenek, roma sato matinako to ko roray no mipa’acaay.
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.
我今天七點到學校。: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。

pito ko toki tahiraay to kako i pitilida: Ma’araw ko kinaolah ni ama to nai litengay a kakaenen, tada malata’ang ato mahemek ko faloco’ ako.
Seeing my grandmother's passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
我今天七點到學校。: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
